intro: Crotalaria thomensis, commonly known as the Cape Verde crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Crotalaria thomensis is also known for its toxic properties, containing alkaloids that can be harmful to livestock and humans.
